page.title: 04St. Helen's Church
page.content: There has been a church in Hemsworth since the 12th century. Most of the present church dates back to 1828. The bell tower is 27 metres tall and it holds eight bells. All the bells were rung for Queen Elizabeth's coronation. Six of the bells were replaced prior to this and they were first rung on 2nd June l953. From 1975 to 1985 there have been six priests in the parish. Last year, 1984, there were thirty-six weddings and ninety-six funerals. The yew tree in the churchyard was hit by lightning on the Eve of the Conversion of St.Paul in 1884, so it is well over one-hundred years old.
